availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel F. James (Mercer County, KY, Farmer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Mary Jane Constant James in Mercer County, Kentucky on February 24, 1858. Father of John C. James, William F. James, Margaret J. James, Martha A. James, Matilda F. James, Sarah W. James, Daniel B. James, Henry F. James, and Alma H. James. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 561.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, City/District, p. 452A
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film #000191863, p. 467
